oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WAVE RUN-UP LIMITS: MAPPING MARITIME PUBLIC DOMAIN IN PORTUGAL
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Coelho, Carlos
Teixeira, Nelson
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave run-up
maritime public domain
wave height and beach slope
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The maritime public domain in Portugal is defined for each place, by the line corresponding to the maximum high tide of equinoctial spring tides, depending on the waves run-up under average waves heights conditions. This approach has created challenges and problems to the responsible entities, which are not solved yet. The choice of a specific study area allows the definition of a suitable method to run-up evaluation, the perception of the difficulties in evaluating the LMPMAVE, and its application at the study site leading to definition of the effective boundary line in the field.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 34 (2014): Proceedings of 34th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Seoul, Korea, 2014; posters.23
